message_1: A rectangular tank with dimensions 2m x 4m x 3m is filled with water. The top of the tank is open to the atmosphere. Determine the  pressure at the bottom of the tank in pascals and pounds per square inch. The density of water is 1000 kg/m³ and g=9.81 m/s².
message_2:
To determine the pressure at the bottom of the tank, we can use the hydrostatic pressure formula:

P = ρgh

where P is the pressure, ρ is the density of the fluid (water in this case), g is the acceleration due to gravity, and h is the depth of the fluid.

Given:
ρ = 1000 kg/m³ (density of water)
g = 9.81 m/s² (acceleration due to gravity)
h = 3 m (depth of the tank)

Now, we can calculate the pressure at the bottom of the tank:

P = (1000 kg/m³)(9.81 m/s²)(3 m)
P = 29430 kg m/s² m²
P = 29430 N/m² (since 1 N = 1 kg m/s²)

So, the pressure at the bottom of the tank is 29,430 pascals (Pa).

To convert the pressure to pounds per square inch (psi), we can use the following conversion factor:

1 psi ≈ 6894.76 Pa

Now, we can convert the pressure to psi:

P = 29430 Pa / 6894.76 Pa/psi
P ≈ 4.27 psi

Therefore, the pressure at the bottom of the tank is approximately 4.27 psi.
